results.title: Benedictus
results.brief_description: A mood film which attempts to convey the passage of human life. Simple still nature photography is used to illustrate the theme, with the camera focussing and de-focussing on the subject. A lyrical flute accompaniment gives emphasis to this quiet unassuming film. No other credits available.

results.title: Beneath the frozen world
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Undersea World of Jacques Cousteau”.
The Jacques Cousteau team photograph underwater the life and iceforms of Antarctica, during its brief summer. Suitable for Upper Primary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Beneath the dream
results.creator_credit: Peter Pastorelle, Nihon Hoso Kyokai and UNICEF
results.brief_description: Fuku and Lee are two young Chinese women helping underprivileged youngsters on the island of Hong Kong. One teaches the island’s many working children at a part-time school. The other runs a mobile library (supplied by UNICEF) bringing books, a chance for recreation and learning, to children living along the shores in sampans.

results.title: Bending lead pipes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plumbing”.
The process of bending a lead pipe subjects it to certain stresses and strains. Shows the procedure to correct the difference in pipe wall thickness that occurs.

results.title: Below the high plain
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Joe Scully and Ian Dunlop
results.brief_description: Describes the State Electricity Commission’s hydro-electric scheme in north-eastern Victoria as seen by those who live on the job and those who find their recreation in this playground area of the ‘Australian Alps’. Set against a background of mountains, rivers and picturesque reservoirs in the mountain valleys, it is a documentary with a strong human element, describing in non-technical language the construction and operation of this major electricity undertaking. The film shows the alpine region in summer and winter, and the wide range of sport and natural attractions it offers the tourist.

results.title: Belonging to the group: respect as a human value
results.creator_credit: John T. Bobbitt and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Shows how an American family and a refugee family from Europe who move at the same time into a typical American community make adjustments and are accepted into groups at school, at work and at church. Discusses the need for people to respect and accept one another in a free society; explains the vital role of groups within a community; emphasises the importance of acquiring the feeling of belonging to a group; indicates community values and their relation to the democratic way of life.

results.title: Belly on fire
results.brief_description: Looks at the work of the Pigbel Foundation in counteracting and preventing the spread of the pigbel disease which affects the intestines of New Guinea villagers. Shows how the poor diet of the people, inadequate hygiene and the sudden intake of pigmeat during festivals combine to trigger off the disastrous proliferation of the pigbel organism, particularly in young children. Suitable for Upper Secondary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Bellamy's Daintree: where reef meets rainforest
results.creator_credit: Wilderness Society and Australian Conservation Foundation
results.brief_description: David Bellamy shows how quickly our rainforests - the most diverse living system on land - are disappearing. He then catalogues the reasons why we should not be destroying our few remaining rainforests including genetic reserves retained in these forests.
